intro: Clermontia clermontioides subsp. rockiana, commonly known as Rockiana's Clermontia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and stream banks. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color and are pollinated by native bees and other insects. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, this subspecies is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
